content: There is no information provided in the prev_chunk to assist with summarizing the curr_chunk "OF CERTAIN CLAIMS AGAINST IRAQ." The President must certify within 90 days that Iraq has settled certain claims, or waiver authority will terminate. The President must certify to Congress within 30 days that Iraq has not compensated foreign entities for claims incurred by the Saddam Hussein regime, including commercial or financial claims, or waiver authority will terminate. The President must certify to Congress within 30 days that negotiations with the Government of Iraq for settling claims are being conducted in good faith, or waiver authority will terminate. The President must certify negotiations with Iraq for claim settlements within 30 days, or waiver authority ends. Certifications last 180 days and can be renewed. Specific court cases are referenced, and adequate settlement involves payment by Iraq or a US depository guarantee. The depository institution must pay specific amounts to individuals with claims related to hostage taking or torture, up to a maximum of $900,000. The depository institution must pay $2,500,000 plus $6,000 per day for torture victims who were hostages. Spouses or children of qualifying individuals receive one third of the payment. Those with prior compensatory damages judgments can receive the unsatisfied amount. The section outlines the conditions for payment of judgments, including a maximum amount of $1,000,000 and one third of any excess amount. If a depository institution guarantees payment but fails to do so within 30 days, waiver authority terminates. In this section, definitions are provided for terms such as "foreign person or entity," "hostage," "hostage status," and "hostage taking." These definitions clarify the meaning of these terms in the context of the law. In this section, definitions are provided for terms such as "national of the United States," "torture," and "United States depository institution." These definitions clarify the meaning of these terms in the context of the law. SEC. 4. LIMITATION ON CERTAIN CLAIMS. No US Government funds can be used to pay claims under section 1605A of title 28, US Code, for damages against Iraq for acts by Iraqi Government officials under Saddam Hussein. Waiver authority under section 1083(d) of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2008 applies.
